title: You can always feel product/market fit when it's happening
author: Marc Andreessen

style_data.description: J.M.W. Turner's luminous atmospheric technique where light dissolves form
style_data.base_prompt: J.M.W. Turner style atmospheric luminism with golden light dissolving and emerging from forms, soft focus throughout composition, luminous passages where paint itself seems to glow, forms suggested rather than defined by light, atmospheric perspective creating infinite depth
style_data.color_philosophy: Golden and warm light palette with forms emerging from luminous atmosphere
style_data.brush_approach: Soft, blended brushwork where edges dissolve into light
style_data.light_focus: Light as the primary subject with forms secondary to atmospheric effects

prompt.text: J.M.W. Turner style atmospheric luminism with golden light dissolving and emerging from forms, soft focus throughout composition, luminous passages where paint itself seems to glow, forms suggested rather than defined by light, atmospheric perspective creating infinite depth. Capturing the vibe of movement, flow, in-the-zone. square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

components.base: J.M.W. Turner style atmospheric luminism with golden light dissolving and emerging from forms, soft focus throughout composition, luminous passages where paint itself seems to glow, forms suggested rather than defined by light, atmospheric perspective creating infinite depth
components.format: square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

metadata.why_i_like_it:
Timeless piece. Describes the mission of investing and building, and captures the feeling when it's working and when it's not, without listing a metric. I re-read it a couple times a year.

Known irony - personal projects don't have PMF :)

formatted_content.html:
And you can always feel product/market fit when it's happening.

The customers are buying the product just as fast as you can make it—or usage is growing just as fast as you can add more servers. Money from customers is piling up in your company checking account.

You're hiring sales and customer support staff as fast as you can. Reporters are calling because they've heard about your hot new thing and they want to talk to you about it. You start getting entrepreneur of the year awards from Harvard Business School. Investment bankers are staking out your house.
formatted_content.plain:
**And you can always feel product/market fit when it's happening.**

The customers are buying the product just as fast as you can make it—or usage is growing just as fast as you can add more servers. Money from customers is piling up in your company checking account.

You're hiring sales and customer support staff as fast as you can. Reporters are calling because they've heard about your hot new thing and they want to talk to you about it. You start getting entrepreneur of the year awards from Harvard Business School. Investment bankers are staking out your house.

title: Start with the customer experience and work backwards to the technology
author: Steve Jobs
quote_text: You've gotta start with the customer experience and work backwards to the technology.

prompt.text: Capturing the vibe of clarity, inspiration. square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

components.format: square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

metadata.why_i_like_it: Masterful clarity, inspiration and motivation. This encapsulates the entire philosophy of great product development - understanding what people actually need and want.

formatted_content.html: You've gotta start with the customer experience and work backwards to the technology.
formatted_content.plain: You've gotta start with the customer experience and work backwards to the technology.

style_data.description: Claude Monet's broken brushwork technique capturing fleeting light effects
style_data.base_prompt: Claude Monet style impressionist technique with broken visible brushstrokes capturing fleeting effects of light and atmosphere, colors that interact and influence each other optically, emphasis on temporal specificity and momentary atmospheric conditions, loose brushwork suggesting form through color temperature and value
style_data.color_philosophy: Colors that interact optically to create new emotional temperatures and atmospheric effects
style_data.brush_approach: Quick confident strokes that capture essence and light rather than precise form
style_data.light_focus: Fleeting effects of light and atmosphere as primary subject matter

prompt.text: Claude Monet style impressionist technique with broken visible brushstrokes capturing fleeting effects of light and atmosphere, colors that interact and influence each other optically, emphasis on temporal specificity and momentary atmospheric conditions, loose brushwork suggesting form through color temperature and value. Capturing the vibe of zen of purpose. square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

components.base: Claude Monet style impressionist technique with broken visible brushstrokes capturing fleeting effects of light and atmosphere, colors that interact and influence each other optically, emphasis on temporal specificity and momentary atmospheric conditions, loose brushwork suggesting form through color temperature and value
components.format: square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

metadata.why_i_like_it:
PG's wisdom resonates with me. This is the best single encapsulation of a startup or product mission I have come across. I try to challenge myself with this often.
Known irony - this nano banana sandbox is something I wanted to make for myself. :)
